parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) trans: I hand in, give up, (b) intrans: I give way (to the wind). From epi and didomi; to give over.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
